DataElement.preferredName: Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale 6 Last 2 Weeks Urinary Frequency and Urgency Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation in the last two weeks describing their urinary frequency and urgency, using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale Past 2 Weeks Urinary Frequency and Urgency Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 10-item self-report questionnaire that measures quality of life for men with prostate cancer._A period of time consisting of the 14 days before the present._A question about an individual's frequency and urgency of passing urine._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A 10-item self-report questionnaire that measures quality of life for men with prostate cancer.

Concepts.definition: A 10-item self-report questionnaire that measures quality of life for men with prostate cancer.

Property.preferredName: Past 2 Weeks Urinary Frequency and Urgency Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A period of time consisting of the 14 days before the present.:A question about an individual's frequency and urgency of passing urine.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A period of time consisting of the 14 days before the present.
A question about an individual's frequency and urgency of passing urine.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: PORPUS:Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale, Krahn M, Ritvo P, Irvine J, et al., J Clin Epidemiol 2000

ValueDomain.preferredName: Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale Urine Freq 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual feels or felt no urinary frequency or urgency.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual feels or felt no urinary frequency or urgency.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Little Urinary Frequency or Urgency; Does not Interfere with Sleep or Other Activities

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Little Urinary Frequency or Urgency; Does not Interfere with Sleep or Other Activities
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual feels or felt a little urinary frequency or urgency, but it does not interfere with sleep or other activities.

Concepts.longName: Little Urinary Frequency or Urgency; Does not Interfere with Sleep or Other Activities
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual feels or felt a little urinary frequency or urgency, but it does not interfere with sleep or other activities.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Some Urinary Frequency or Urgency that Interferes with Sleep or Other Activities; May Need to Plan Ahead

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Some Urinary Frequency or Urgency that Interferes with Sleep or Other Activities; May Need to Plan Ahead
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual feels or felt some urinary frequency or urgency that interferes with sleep or other activities and that may make it necessary to plan ahead.

Concepts.longName: Some Urinary Frequency or Urgency that Interferes with Sleep or Other Activities; May Need to Plan Ahead
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual feels or felt some urinary frequency or urgency that interferes with sleep or other activities and that may make it necessary to plan ahead.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Quite a Bit of Urinary Frequency or Urgency; Need to be Near Bathroom Most of the Time

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Quite a Bit of Urinary Frequency or Urgency; Need to be Near Bathroom Most of the Time
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual feels or felt quite a bit of urinary frequency or urgency, making it necessary to be near a bathroom most of the time.

Concepts.longName: Quite a Bit of Urinary Frequency or Urgency; Need to be Near Bathroom Most of the Time
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual feels or felt quite a bit of urinary frequency or urgency, making it necessary to be near a bathroom most of the time.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Extreme Urinary Frequency or Urgency; Need to be Near a Bathroom Always

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Extreme Urinary Frequency or Urgency; Need to be Near a Bathroom Always
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual feels or felt extreme urinary frequency or urgency, making it necessary to be near a bathroom always.

Concepts.longName: Extreme Urinary Frequency or Urgency; Need to be Near a Bathroom Always
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual feels or felt extreme urinary frequency or urgency, making it necessary to be near a bathroom always.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueDomain.origin: PORPUS:Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale, Krahn M, Ritvo P, Irvine J, et al., J Clin Epidemiol 2000

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Please choose the statement t
ReferenceDocuments.description: Please choose the statement that comes closest to describing your urinary frequency and urgency in the last two weeks.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

DataElement.origin: PORPUS:Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale, Krahn M, Ritvo P, Irvine J, et al., J Clin Epidemiol 2000
